name: Blockworks Daily
title: Utf8b8jfqg Friday Paradoxical Charts
text:
Synopsis
The emergence of DeepSeek's AI technology represents a potential paradigm shift in AI efficiency, with implications for tech investment strategies, potentially challenging existing market assumptions about GPU and cloud computing demand.

Key Insights
- DeepSeek's R1 chatbot was called a "Sputnik moment" by Marc Andreessen, prompting immediate competitive responses from major tech companies like Meta
- MIT researcher Olivier Blanchard described DeepSeek as potentially representing the largest one-day improvement in total factor productivity growth in history
- DeepSeek reportedly spent less than $6 million to become the most downloaded app on Apple's App Store
- UBS expects AI compute industry (cloud providers) earnings to grow 25% annually through 2029
- The equity risk premium has dropped to zero, the lowest level since the dotcom boom, raising concerns about a potential market bubble
- Microsoft's Satya Nadella predicts that as AI becomes more efficient, demand will increase exponentially - invoking Jevons paradox
- Less than one-third of S&P 500 stocks have outperformed the index in the past two years, the lowest since the dotcom bust
- Nvidia's projected path to $250 billion in annual profits is being questioned by investors
- The AI and data center building boom is so intense that it may strain electrical grid capacity
